mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Robert Dinwiddie, 1754 March 7
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Washington wrote this letter to Lieutenant-Governor Dinwiddie as he prepared for his first military appointment, an expedition with 160 soldiers to the forks of the Allegheny, Ohio and Monongahela Rivers. He requested supplies, uniforms, clarification of pay for troops, and offered his personal observations of Native Americans. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Native Americans
